content: Career General Asked by Jay LiuAsked on 21 Sep 2018What do you think of getting another certificate on top of your current qualification (e.g. Wsq diplomas) in times of retrenchment?From an industry like e.g. Security. For use during financial crisis retrenchment. Is it viable to have another qualification?4 answersAnswerBump2
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Instead of another qualifications, unless you are sure that qualifications can get you jobs and pays ok or the same as current. May qualifications may not work that well during downturns. ​If you can, pick up a side line, a skill or transform your hobbies now into a side income while the time is good now and when the time is bad, it serve as a back up or possibly one day becomes your own main :) ​On the other hand, also network to people in the same and different but related field, as the people you know if you provide good service to them, they might be a good recommedations to you one day for a better job or in bad times. ​I believe in bad times, skills wins over cert! In all times, connections and the friends you know wins you over skills and cert! ​Cheers! ​2 comments1

Jay Liu23 Sep 2018Agreed man. Connections are important. Sign a few job contracts as a part timer in the past without needed to be interviewed. HC Tang24 Sep 2018Wow. Great man ! Hope you do even better 😄👍

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 21 Sep 2018Those WSQ and other certificates don't really make you more employable. Those are just "hobby learning" status.​Compared to really quality certs like CCNA, PMP, CFA type of status, those WSQ ones are really no use.0 comments1

Kenichi Xi, nᴉʍ oʇ dǝnᴉʇsǝd 不能说的秘密 at Tag Team with Gabriel ThamLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019A driving licence or a bike licence if u didn't have one will be more useful then most skills future course.You need to be more realistic then to believe a "new diploma cert" will get u a job.Is ultimately the skills and attitude that will bring you better results in a job retrenchment period.Hope my reply helps.If you feel this reply have Quality, please upvote and check other Quality Reply.https://seedly.sg/profile/a-kenichi-xiThank you.2 comments0
Jay Liu24 Sep 2018Converting military class 3 licence to civilian licence in 4 months time!!!! Sad can't get class 4 :/Kenichi Xi28 Sep 2018u saved a lot le. Keep it up and progress on. @jay liu

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Sep 20181) If it's related to the industry that you are or planning to work in, can consider going for it since it might make you stand out from your peers/competitors​2) If you can pay for the course using SkillsFuture credits and if you have free time, why not0 comments0
